text: Adam, Seth, Enosh,
speaker: Narrator

text: Kenan, Mahalalel, Jared,
speaker: Narrator

text: Enoch, Methuselah, Lamech,
speaker: Narrator

text: Noah, Shem, Ham and Japheth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Japheth were Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech and Tiras.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Gomer were Ashkenaz, Diphath, and Togarmah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Javan were Elishah, Tarshish, Kittim and Rodanim.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ham were Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Cush were Seba, Havilah, Sabta, Raama and Sabteca; and the sons of Raamah were Sheba and Dedan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cush became the father of Nimrod; he began to be a mighty one in the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mizraim became the father of the people of Lud, Anam, Lehab, Naphtuh,
speaker: Narrator

text: Pathrus, Casluh, from which the Philistines came, and Caphtor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Canaan became the father of Sidon, his firstborn, Heth,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the Jebusites, the Amorites, the Girgashites,
speaker: Narrator

text: the Hivites, the Arkites, the Sinites,
speaker: Narrator

text: the Arvadites, the Zemarites and the Hamathites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shem were Elam, Asshur, Arpachshad, Lud, Aram, Uz, Hul, Gether and Meshech.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arpachshad became the father of Shelah and Shelah became the father of Eber.
speaker: Narrator

text: Two sons were born to Eber, the name of the one was Peleg, for in his days the earth was divided, and his brother’s name was Joktan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joktan became the father of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ebal, Abimael, Sheba,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ophir, Havilah and Jobab; all these were the sons of Joktan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shem, Arpachshad, Shelah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eber, Peleg, Reu,
speaker: Narrator

text: Serug, Nahor, Terah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Abram, that is Abraham.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Abraham were Isaac and Ishmael.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are their genealogies: the firstborn of Ishmael was Nebaioth, then Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,
speaker: Narrator

text: Mishma, Dumah, Massa, Hadad, Tema,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jetur, Naphish and Kedemah; these were the sons of Ishmael.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Keturah, Abraham’s concubine, whom she bore, were Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak and Shuah. And the sons of Jokshan were Sheba and Dedan.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Midian were Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abida and Eldaah. All these were the sons of Keturah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Abraham became the father of Isaac. The sons of Isaac were Esau and Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Esau were Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jalam and Korah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Eliphaz were Teman, Omar, Zephi, Gatam, Kenaz, Timna and Amalek.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Reuel were Nahath, Zerah, Shammah and Mizzah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Seir were Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer and Dishan.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Lotan were Hori and Homam; and Lotan’s sister was Timna.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shobal were Alian, Manahath, Ebal, Shephi and Onam. And the sons of Zibeon were Aiah and Anah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Anah was Dishon. And the sons of Dishon were Hamran, Eshban, Ithran and Cheran.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ezer were Bilhan, Zaavan and Jaakan. The sons of Dishan were Uz and Aran.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the kings who reigned in the land of Edom before any king of the sons of Israel reigned. Bela was the son of Beor, and the name of his city was Dinhabah.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Bela died, Jobab the son of Zerah of Bozrah became king in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jobab died, Husham of the land of the Temanites became king in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Husham died, Hadad the son of Bedad, who defeated Midian in the field of Moab, became king in his place; and the name of his city was Avith.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Hadad died, Samlah of Masrekah became king in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Samlah died, Shaul of Rehoboth by the River became king in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Shaul died, Baal-hanan the son of Achbor became king in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Baal-hanan died, Hadad became king in his place; and the name of his city was Pai, and his wife’s name was Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Mezahab.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then Hadad died.
Now the chiefs of Edom were: chief Timna, chief Aliah, chief Jetheth,
speaker: Narrator

text: chief Oholibamah, chief Elah, chief Pinon,
speaker: Narrator

text: chief Kenaz, chief Teman, chief Mibzar,
speaker: Narrator

text: chief Magdiel, chief Iram. These were the chiefs of Edom.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the sons of Israel: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun,
speaker: Narrator

text: Dan, Joseph, Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad and Asher.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Judah were Er, Onan and Shelah; these three were born to him by Bath-shua the Canaanitess. And Er, Judah’s firstborn, was wicked in the sight of the Lord, so He put him to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Tamar his daughter-in-law bore him Perez and Zerah. Judah had five sons in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Perez were Hezron and Hamul.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Zerah were Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Calcol and Dara; five of them in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Carmi was Achar, the troubler of Israel, who violated the ban.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Ethan was Azariah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the sons of Hezron, who were born to him were Jerahmeel, Ram and Chelubai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ram became the father of Amminadab, and Amminadab became the father of Nahshon, leader of the sons of Judah;
speaker: Narrator

text: Nahshon became the father of Salma, Salma became the father of Boaz,
speaker: Narrator

text: Boaz became the father of Obed, and Obed became the father of Jesse;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Jesse became the father of Eliab his firstborn, then Abinadab the second, Shimea the third,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nethanel the fourth, Raddai the fifth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ozem the sixth, David the seventh;
speaker: Narrator

text: and their sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. And the three sons of Zeruiah were Abshai, Joab and Asahel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Abigail bore Amasa, and the father of Amasa was Jether the Ishmaelite.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Caleb the son of Hezron had sons by Azubah his wife, and by Jerioth; and these were her sons: Jesher, Shobab, and Ardon.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Azubah died, Caleb married Ephrath, who bore him Hur.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hur became the father of Uri, and Uri became the father of Bezalel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward Hezron went in to the daughter of Machir the father of Gilead, whom he married when he was sixty years old; and she bore him Segub.
speaker: Narrator

text: Segub became the father of Jair, who had twenty-three cities in the land of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Geshur and Aram took the towns of Jair from them, with Kenath and its villages, even sixty cities. All these were the sons of Machir, the father of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: After the death of Hezron in Caleb-ephrathah, Abijah, Hezron’s wife, bore him Ashhur the father of Tekoa.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the sons of Jerahmeel the firstborn of Hezron were Ram the firstborn, then Bunah, Oren, Ozem and Ahijah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jerahmeel had another wife, whose name was Atarah; she was the mother of Onam.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ram, the firstborn of Jerahmeel, were Maaz, Jamin and Eker.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Onam were Shammai and Jada. And the sons of Shammai were Nadab and Abishur.
speaker: Narrator

text: The name of Abishur’s wife was Abihail, and she bore him Ahban and Molid.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Nadab were Seled and Appaim, and Seled died without sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Appaim was Ishi. And the son of Ishi was Sheshan. And the son of Sheshan was Ahlai.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jada the brother of Shammai were Jether and Jonathan, and Jether died without sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jonathan were Peleth and Zaza. These were the sons of Jerahmeel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Sheshan had no sons, only daughters. And Sheshan had an Egyptian servant whose name was Jarha.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sheshan gave his daughter to Jarha his servant in marriage, and she bore him Attai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Attai became the father of Nathan, and Nathan became the father of Zabad,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Zabad became the father of Ephlal, and Ephlal became the father of Obed,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Obed became the father of Jehu, and Jehu became the father of Azariah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Azariah became the father of Helez, and Helez became the father of Eleasah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Eleasah became the father of Sismai, and Sismai became the father of Shallum,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Shallum became the father of Jekamiah, and Jekamiah became the father of Elishama.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the sons of Caleb, the brother of Jerahmeel, were Mesha his firstborn, who was the father of Ziph; and his son was Mareshah, the father of Hebron.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Hebron were Korah and Tappuah and Rekem and Shema.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shema became the father of Raham, the father of Jorkeam; and Rekem became the father of Shammai.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Shammai was Maon, and Maon was the father of Bethzur.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ephah, Caleb’s concubine, bore Haran, Moza and Gazez; and Haran became the father of Gazez.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jahdai were Regem, Jotham, Geshan, Pelet, Ephah and Shaaph.
speaker: Narrator

text: Maacah, Caleb’s concubine, bore Sheber and Tirhanah.
speaker: Narrator

text: She also bore Shaaph the father of Madmannah, Sheva the father of Machbena and the father of Gibea; and the daughter of Caleb was Achsah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
These were the sons of Caleb.
The sons of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah, were Shobal the father of Kiriath-jearim,
speaker: Narrator

text: Salma the father of Bethlehem and Hareph the father of Beth-gader.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shobal the father of Kiriath-jearim had sons: Haroeh, half of the Manahathites,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the families of Kiriath-jearim: the Ithrites, the Puthites, the Shumathites and the Mishraites; from these came the Zorathites and the Eshtaolites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Salma were Bethlehem and the Netophathites, Atroth-beth-joab and half of the Manahathites, the Zorites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The families of scribes who lived at Jabez were the Tirathites, the Shimeathites and the Sucathites. Those are the Kenites who came from Hammath, the father of the house of Rechab.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these were the sons of David who were born to him in Hebron: the firstborn was Amnon, by Ahinoam the Jezreelitess; the second was Daniel, by Abigail the Carmelitess;
speaker: Narrator

text: the third was Absalom the son of Maacah, the daughter of Talmai king of Geshur; the fourth was Adonijah the son of Haggith;
speaker: Narrator

text: the fifth was Shephatiah, by Abital; the sixth was Ithream, by his wife Eglah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Six were born to him in Hebron, and there he reigned seven years and six months. And in Jerusalem he reigned thirty-three years.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were born to him in Jerusalem: Shimea, Shobab, Nathan and Solomon, four, by Bath-shua the daughter of Ammiel;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Ibhar, Elishama, Eliphelet,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nogah, Nepheg and Japhia,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elishama, Eliada and Eliphelet, nine.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these were the sons of David, besides the sons of the concubines; and Tamar was their sister.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Solomon’s son was Rehoboam, Abijah was his son, Asa his son, Jehoshaphat his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Joram his son, Ahaziah his son, Joash his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Amaziah his son, Azariah his son, Jotham his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahaz his son, Hezekiah his son, Manasseh his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Amon his son, Josiah his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Josiah were Johanan the firstborn, and the second was Jehoiakim, the third Zedekiah, the fourth Shallum.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jehoiakim were Jeconiah his son, Zedekiah his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jeconiah, the prisoner, were Shealtiel his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Malchiram, Pedaiah, Shenazzar, Jekamiah, Hoshama and Nedabiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Pedaiah were Zerubbabel and Shimei. And the sons of Zerubbabel were Meshullam and Hananiah, and Shelomith was their sister;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Hashubah, Ohel, Berechiah, Hasadiah and Jushab-hesed, five.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Hananiah were Pelatiah and Jeshaiah, the sons of Rephaiah, the sons of Arnan, the sons of Obadiah, the sons of Shecaniah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Shecaniah were Shemaiah, and the sons of Shemaiah: Hattush, Igal, Bariah, Neariah and Shaphat, six.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Neariah were Elioenai, Hizkiah and Azrikam, three.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Elioenai were Hodaviah, Eliashib, Pelaiah, Akkub, Johanan, Delaiah and Anani, seven.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Judah were Perez, Hezron, Carmi, Hur and Shobal.
speaker: Narrator

text: Reaiah the son of Shobal became the father of Jahath, and Jahath became the father of Ahumai and Lahad. These were the families of the Zorathites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the sons of Etam: Jezreel, Ishma and Idbash; and the name of their sister was Hazzelelponi.
speaker: Narrator

text: Penuel was the father of Gedor, and Ezer the father of Hushah. These were the sons of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah, the father of Bethlehem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ashhur, the father of Tekoa, had two wives, Helah and Naarah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Naarah bore him Ahuzzam, Hepher, Temeni and Haahashtari. These were the sons of Naarah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Helah were Zereth, Izhar and Ethnan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Koz became the father of Anub and Zobebah, and the families of Aharhel the son of Harum.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jabez was more honorable than his brothers, and his mother named him Jabez saying, “Because I bore him with pain.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Jabez called on the God of Israel, saying, “Oh that You would bless me indeed and enlarge my border, and that Your hand might be with me, and that You would keep me from harm that it may not pain me!” And God granted him what he requested.
speaker: Narrator

text: Chelub the brother of Shuhah became the father of Mehir, who was the father of Eshton.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eshton became the father of Beth-rapha and Paseah, and Tehinnah the father of Ir-nahash. These are the men of Recah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the sons of Kenaz were Othniel and Seraiah. And the sons of Othniel were Hathath and Meonothai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Meonothai became the father of Ophrah, and Seraiah became the father of Joab the father of Ge-harashim, for they were craftsmen.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Caleb the son of Jephunneh were Iru, Elah and Naam; and the son of Elah was Kenaz.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jehallelel were Ziph and Ziphah, Tiria and Asarel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ezrah were Jether, Mered, Epher and Jalon. (And these are the sons of Bithia the daughter of Pharaoh, whom Mered took) and she conceived and bore Miriam, Shammai and Ishbah the father of Eshtemoa.
speaker: Narrator

text: His Jewish wife bore Jered the father of Gedor, and Heber the father of Soco, and Jekuthiel the father of Zanoah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of the wife of Hodiah, the sister of Naham, were the fathers of Keilah the Garmite and Eshtemoa the Maacathite.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shimon were Amnon and Rinnah, Benhanan and Tilon. And the sons of Ishi were Zoheth and Ben-zoheth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shelah the son of Judah were Er the father of Lecah and Laadah the father of Mareshah, and the families of the house of the linen workers at Beth-ashbea;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Jokim, the men of Cozeba, Joash, Saraph, who ruled in Moab, and Jashubi-lehem. And the records are ancient.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the potters and the inhabitants of Netaim and Gederah; they lived there with the king for his work.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Simeon were Nemuel and Jamin, Jarib, Zerah, Shaul;
speaker: Narrator

text: Shallum his son, Mibsam his son, Mishma his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Mishma were Hammuel his son, Zaccur his son, Shimei his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters; but his brothers did not have many sons, nor did all their family multiply like the sons of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They lived at Beersheba, Moladah and Hazar-shual,
speaker: Narrator

text: at Bilhah, Ezem, Tolad,
speaker: Narrator

text: Bethuel, Hormah, Ziklag,
speaker: Narrator

text: Beth-marcaboth, Hazar-susim, Beth-biri and Shaaraim. These were their cities until the reign of David.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their villages were Etam, Ain, Rimmon, Tochen and Ashan, five cities;
speaker: Narrator

text: and all their villages that were around the same cities as far as Baal. These were their settlements, and they have their genealogy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Meshobab and Jamlech and Joshah the son of Amaziah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Joel and Jehu the son of Joshibiah, the son of Seraiah, the son of Asiel,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Elioenai, Jaakobah, Jeshohaiah, Asaiah, Adiel, Jesimiel, Benaiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ziza the son of Shiphi, the son of Allon, the son of Jedaiah, the son of Shimri, the son of Shemaiah;
speaker: Narrator

text: these mentioned by name were leaders in their families; and their fathers’ houses increased greatly.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went to the entrance of Gedor, even to the east side of the valley, to seek pasture for their flocks.
speaker: Narrator

text: They found rich and good pasture, and the land was broad and quiet and peaceful; for those who lived there formerly were Hamites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These, recorded by name, came in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah, and attacked their tents and the Meunites who were found there, and destroyed them utterly to this day, and lived in their place, because there was pasture there for their flocks.
speaker: Narrator

text: From them, from the sons of Simeon, five hundred men went to Mount Seir, with Pelatiah, Neariah, Rephaiah and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi, as their leaders.
speaker: Narrator

text: They destroyed the remnant of the Amalekites who escaped, and have lived there to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel (for he was the firstborn, but because he defiled his father’s bed, his birthright was given to the sons of Joseph the son of Israel; so that he is not enrolled in the genealogy according to the birthright.
speaker: Narrator

text: Though Judah prevailed over his brothers, and from him came the leader, yet the birthright belonged to Joseph),
speaker: Narrator

text: the sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel were Hanoch and Pallu, Hezron and Carmi.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Joel were Shemaiah his son, Gog his son, Shimei his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Micah his son, Reaiah his son, Baal his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Beerah his son, whom Tilgath-pilneser king of Assyria carried away into exile; he was leader of the Reubenites.
speaker: Narrator

text: His kinsmen by their families, in the genealogy of their generations, were Jeiel the chief, then Zechariah
speaker: Narrator

text: and Bela the son of Azaz, the son of Shema, the son of Joel, who lived in Aroer, even to Nebo and Baal-meon.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the east he settled as far as the entrance of the wilderness from the river Euphrates, because their cattle had increased in the land of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the days of Saul they made war with the Hagrites, who fell by their hand, so that they occupied their tents throughout all the land east of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the sons of Gad lived opposite them in the land of Bashan as far as Salecah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joel was the chief and Shapham the second, then Janai and Shaphat in Bashan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their kinsmen of their fathers’ households were Michael, Meshullam, Sheba, Jorai, Jacan, Zia and Eber, seven.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the sons of Abihail, the son of Huri, the son of Jaroah, the son of Gilead, the son of Michael, the son of Jeshishai, the son of Jahdo, the son of Buz;
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahi the son of Abdiel, the son of Guni, was head of their fathers’ households.
speaker: Narrator

text: They lived in Gilead, in Bashan and in its towns, and in all the pasture lands of Sharon, as far as their borders.
speaker: Narrator

text: All of these were enrolled in the genealogies in the days of Jotham king of Judah and in the days of Jeroboam king of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Reuben and the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh, consisting of valiant men, men who bore shield and sword and shot with bow and were skillful in battle, were 44,760, who went to war.
speaker: Narrator

text: They made war against the Hagrites, Jetur, Naphish and Nodab.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were helped against them, and the Hagrites and all who were with them were given into their hand; for they cried out to God in the battle, and He answered their prayers because they trusted in Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They took away their cattle: their 50,000 camels, 250,000 sheep, 2,000 donkeys; and 100,000 men.
speaker: Narrator

text: For many fell slain, because the war was of God. And they settled in their place until the exile.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the sons of the half-tribe of Manasseh lived in the land; from Bashan to Baal-hermon and Senir and Mount Hermon they were numerous.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the heads of their fathers’ households, even Epher, Ishi, Eliel, Azriel, Jeremiah, Hodaviah and Jahdiel, mighty men of valor, famous men, heads of their fathers’ households.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they acted treacherously against the God of their fathers and played the harlot after the gods of the peoples of the land, whom God had destroyed before them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the God of Israel stirred up the spirit of Pul, king of Assyria, even the spirit of Tilgath-pilneser king of Assyria, and he carried them away into exile, namely the Reubenites, the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh, and brought them to Halah, Habor, Hara and to the river of Gozan, to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Levi were Gershon, Kohath and Merari.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Kohath were Amram, Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The children of Amram were Aaron, Moses and Miriam. And the sons of Aaron were Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eleazar became the father of Phinehas, and Phinehas became the father of Abishua,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Abishua became the father of Bukki, and Bukki became the father of Uzzi,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Uzzi became the father of Zerahiah, and Zerahiah became the father of Meraioth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Meraioth became the father of Amariah, and Amariah became the father of Ahitub,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Ahitub became the father of Zadok, and Zadok became the father of Ahimaaz,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Ahimaaz became the father of Azariah, and Azariah became the father of Johanan,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Johanan became the father of Azariah (it was he who served as the priest in the house which Solomon built in Jerusalem),
speaker: Narrator

text: and Azariah became the father of Amariah, and Amariah became the father of Ahitub,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Ahitub became the father of Zadok, and Zadok became the father of Shallum,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Shallum became the father of Hilkiah, and Hilkiah became the father of Azariah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Azariah became the father of Seraiah, and Seraiah became the father of Jehozadak;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Jehozadak went along when the Lord carried Judah and Jerusalem away into exile by Nebuchadnezzar.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Levi were Gershom, Kohath and Merari.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the names of the sons of Gershom: Libni and Shimei.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Kohath were Amram, Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Merari were Mahli and Mushi. And these are the families of the Levites according to their fathers’ households.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Gershom: Libni his son, Jahath his son, Zimmah his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Joah his son, Iddo his son, Zerah his son, Jeatherai his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Kohath were Amminadab his son, Korah his son, Assir his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elkanah his son, Ebiasaph his son and Assir his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Tahath his son, Uriel his son, Uzziah his son and Shaul his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Elkanah were Amasai and Ahimoth.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for Elkanah, the sons of Elkanah were Zophai his son and Nahath his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eliab his son, Jeroham his son, Elkanah his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Samuel were Joel the firstborn, and Abijah the second.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Merari were Mahli, Libni his son, Shimei his son, Uzzah his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Shimea his son, Haggiah his son, Asaiah his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are those whom David appointed over the service of song in the house of the Lord, after the ark rested there.
speaker: Narrator

text: They ministered with song before the tabernacle of the tent of meeting, until Solomon had built the house of the Lord in Jerusalem; and they served in their office according to their order.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are those who served with their sons: From the sons of the Kohathites were Heman the singer, the son of Joel, the son of Samuel,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Elkanah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Eliel, the son of Toah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Zuph, the son of Elkanah, the son of Mahath, the son of Amasai,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Elkanah, the son of Joel, the son of Azariah, the son of Zephaniah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Tahath, the son of Assir, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, the son of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Heman’s brother Asaph stood at his right hand, even Asaph the son of Berechiah, the son of Shimea,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Michael, the son of Baaseiah, the son of Malchijah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Ethni, the son of Zerah, the son of Adaiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Ethan, the son of Zimmah, the son of Shimei,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Jahath, the son of Gershom, the son of Levi.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the left hand were their kinsmen the sons of Merari: Ethan the son of Kishi, the son of Abdi, the son of Malluch,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Hashabiah, the son of Amaziah, the son of Hilkiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Amzi, the son of Bani, the son of Shemer,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Mahli, the son of Mushi, the son of Merari, the son of Levi.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their kinsmen the Levites were appointed for all the service of the tabernacle of the house of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Aaron and his sons offered on the altar of burnt offering and on the altar of incense, for all the work of the most holy place, and to make atonement for Israel, according to all that Moses the servant of God had commanded.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the sons of Aaron: Eleazar his son, Phinehas his son, Abishua his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Bukki his son, Uzzi his son, Zerahiah his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Meraioth his son, Amariah his son, Ahitub his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Zadok his son, Ahimaaz his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are their settlements according to their camps within their borders. To the sons of Aaron of the families of the Kohathites (for theirs was the first lot),
speaker: Narrator

text: to them they gave Hebron in the land of Judah and its pasture lands around it;
speaker: Narrator

text: but the fields of the city and its villages, they gave to Caleb the son of Jephunneh.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the sons of Aaron they gave the following cities of refuge: Hebron, Libnah also with its pasture lands, Jattir, Eshtemoa with its pasture lands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hilen with its pasture lands, Debir with its pasture lands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ashan with its pasture lands and Beth-shemesh with its pasture lands;
speaker: Narrator

text: and from the tribe of Benjamin: Geba with its pasture lands, Allemeth with its pasture lands, and Anathoth with its pasture lands. All their cities throughout their families were thirteen cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then to the rest of the sons of Kohath were given by lot, from the family of the tribe, from the half-tribe, the half of Manasseh, ten cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the sons of Gershom, according to their families, were given from the tribe of Issachar and from the tribe of Asher, the tribe of Naphtali, and the tribe of Manasseh, thirteen cities in Bashan.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the sons of Merari were given by lot, according to their families, from the tribe of Reuben, the tribe of Gad and the tribe of Zebulun, twelve cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the sons of Israel gave to the Levites the cities with their pasture lands.
speaker: Narrator

text: They gave by lot from the tribe of the sons of Judah, the tribe of the sons of Simeon and the tribe of the sons of Benjamin, these cities which are mentioned by name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now some of the families of the sons of Kohath had cities of their territory from the tribe of Ephraim.
speaker: Narrator

text: They gave to them the following cities of refuge: Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim with its pasture lands, Gezer also with its pasture lands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jokmeam with its pasture lands, Beth-horon with its pasture lands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Aijalon with its pasture lands and Gath-rimmon with its pasture lands;
speaker: Narrator

text: and from the half-tribe of Manasseh: Aner with its pasture lands and Bileam with its pasture lands, for the rest of the family of the sons of Kohath.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the sons of Gershom were given, from the family of the half-tribe of Manasseh: Golan in Bashan with its pasture lands and Ashtaroth with its pasture lands;
speaker: Narrator

text: and from the tribe of Issachar: Kedesh with its pasture lands, Daberath with its pasture lands
speaker: Narrator

text: and Ramoth with its pasture lands, Anem with its pasture lands;
speaker: Narrator

text: and from the tribe of Asher: Mashal with its pasture lands, Abdon with its pasture lands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hukok with its pasture lands and Rehob with its pasture lands;
speaker: Narrator

text: and from the tribe of Naphtali: Kedesh in Galilee with its pasture lands, Hammon with its pasture lands and Kiriathaim with its pasture lands.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the rest of the Levites, the sons of Merari, were given, from the tribe of Zebulun: Rimmono with its pasture lands, Tabor with its pasture lands;
speaker: Narrator

text: and beyond the Jordan at Jericho, on the east side of the Jordan, were given them, from the tribe of Reuben: Bezer in the wilderness with its pasture lands, Jahzah with its pasture lands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Kedemoth with its pasture lands and Mephaath with its pasture lands;
speaker: Narrator

text: and from the tribe of Gad: Ramoth in Gilead with its pasture lands, Mahanaim with its pasture lands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Heshbon with its pasture lands and Jazer with its pasture lands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the sons of Issachar were four: Tola, Puah, Jashub and Shimron.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Tola were Uzzi, Rephaiah, Jeriel, Jahmai, Ibsam and Samuel, heads of their fathers’ households. The sons of Tola were mighty men of valor in their generations; their number in the days of David was 22,600.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Uzzi was Izrahiah. And the sons of Izrahiah were Michael, Obadiah, Joel, Isshiah; all five of them were chief men.
speaker: Narrator

text: With them by their generations according to their fathers’ households were 36,000 troops of the army for war, for they had many wives and sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their relatives among all the families of Issachar were mighty men of valor, enrolled by genealogy, in all 87,000.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Benjamin were three: Bela and Becher and Jediael.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Bela were five: Ezbon, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth and Iri. They were heads of fathers’ households, mighty men of valor, and were 22,034 enrolled by genealogy.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Becher were Zemirah, Joash, Eliezer, Elioenai, Omri, Jeremoth, Abijah, Anathoth and Alemeth. All these were the sons of Becher.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were enrolled by genealogy, according to their generations, heads of their fathers’ households, 20,200 mighty men of valor.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Jediael was Bilhan. And the sons of Bilhan were Jeush, Benjamin, Ehud, Chenaanah, Zethan, Tarshish and Ahishahar.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these were sons of Jediael, according to the heads of their fathers’ households, 17,200 mighty men of valor, who were ready to go out with the army to war.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shuppim and Huppim were the sons of Ir; Hushim was the son of Aher.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Naphtali were Jahziel, Guni, Jezer, and Shallum, the sons of Bilhah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Manasseh were Asriel, whom his Aramean concubine bore; she bore Machir the father of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Machir took a wife for Huppim and Shuppim, whose sister’s name was Maacah. And the name of the second was Zelophehad, and Zelophehad had daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Maacah the wife of Machir bore a son, and she named him Peresh; and the name of his brother was Sheresh, and his sons were Ulam and Rakem.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Ulam was Bedan. These were the sons of Gilead the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: His sister Hammolecheth bore Ishhod and Abiezer and Mahlah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shemida were Ahian and Shechem and Likhi and Aniam.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ephraim were Shuthelah and Bered his son, Tahath his son, Eleadah his son, Tahath his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Zabad his son, Shuthelah his son, and Ezer and Elead whom the men of Gath who were born in the land killed, because they came down to take their livestock.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their father Ephraim mourned many days, and his relatives came to comfort him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he went in to his wife, and she conceived and bore a son, and he named him Beriah, because misfortune had come upon his house.
speaker: Narrator

text: His daughter was Sheerah, who built lower and upper Beth-horon, also Uzzen-sheerah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rephah was his son along with Resheph, Telah his son, Tahan his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ladan his son, Ammihud his son, Elishama his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Non his son and Joshua his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their possessions and settlements were Bethel with its towns, and to the east Naaran, and to the west Gezer with its towns, and Shechem with its towns as far as Ayyah with its towns,
speaker: Narrator

text: and along the borders of the sons of Manasseh, Beth-shean with its towns, Taanach with its towns, Megiddo with its towns, Dor with its towns. In these lived the sons of Joseph the son of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Asher were Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi and Beriah, and Serah their sister.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Beriah were Heber and Malchiel, who was the father of Birzaith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Heber became the father of Japhlet, Shomer and Hotham, and Shua their sister.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Japhlet were Pasach, Bimhal and Ashvath. These were the sons of Japhlet.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shemer were Ahi and Rohgah, Jehubbah and Aram.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of his brother Helem were Zophah, Imna, Shelesh and Amal.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Zophah were Suah, Harnepher, Shual, Beri and Imrah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Bezer, Hod, Shamma, Shilshah, Ithran and Beera.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jether were Jephunneh, Pispa and Ara.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ulla were Arah, Hanniel and Rizia.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these were the sons of Asher, heads of the fathers’ houses, choice and mighty men of valor, heads of the princes. And the number of them enrolled by genealogy for service in war was 26,000 men.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Benjamin became the father of Bela his firstborn, Ashbel the second, Aharah the third,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nohah the fourth and Rapha the fifth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bela had sons: Addar, Gera, Abihud,
speaker: Narrator

text: Abishua, Naaman, Ahoah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Gera, Shephuphan and Huram.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the sons of Ehud: these are the heads of fathers’ households of the inhabitants of Geba, and they carried them into exile to Manahath,
speaker: Narrator

text: namely, Naaman, Ahijah and Gera—he carried them into exile; and he became the father of Uzza and Ahihud.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shaharaim became the father of children in the country of Moab after he had sent away Hushim and Baara his wives.
speaker: Narrator

text: By Hodesh his wife he became the father of Jobab, Zibia, Mesha, Malcam,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jeuz, Sachia, Mirmah. These were his sons, heads of fathers’ households.
speaker: Narrator

text: By Hushim he became the father of Abitub and Elpaal.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Elpaal were Eber, Misham, and Shemed, who built Ono and Lod, with its towns;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Beriah and Shema, who were heads of fathers’ households of the inhabitants of Aijalon, who put to flight the inhabitants of Gath;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Ahio, Shashak and Jeremoth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zebadiah, Arad, Eder,
speaker: Narrator

text: Michael, Ishpah and Joha were the sons of Beriah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zebadiah, Meshullam, Hizki, Heber,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ishmerai, Izliah and Jobab were the sons of Elpaal.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jakim, Zichri, Zabdi,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elienai, Zillethai, Eliel,
speaker: Narrator

text: Adaiah, Beraiah and Shimrath were the sons of Shimei.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ishpan, Eber, Eliel,
speaker: Narrator

text: Abdon, Zichri, Hanan,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hananiah, Elam, Anthothijah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Iphdeiah and Penuel were the sons of Shashak.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shamsherai, Shehariah, Athaliah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jaareshiah, Elijah and Zichri were the sons of Jeroham.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were heads of the fathers’ households according to their generations, chief men who lived in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now in Gibeon, Jeiel, the father of Gibeon lived, and his wife’s name was Maacah;
speaker: Narrator

text: and his firstborn son was Abdon, then Zur, Kish, Baal, Nadab,
speaker: Narrator

text: Gedor, Ahio and Zecher.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mikloth became the father of Shimeah. And they also lived with their relatives in Jerusalem opposite their other relatives.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ner became the father of Kish, and Kish became the father of Saul, and Saul became the father of Jonathan, Malchi-shua, Abinadab and Eshbaal.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Jonathan was Merib-baal, and Merib-baal became the father of Micah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Micah were Pithon, Melech, Tarea and Ahaz.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahaz became the father of Jehoaddah, and Jehoaddah became the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth and Zimri; and Zimri became the father of Moza.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moza became the father of Binea; Raphah was his son, Eleasah his son, Azel his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Azel had six sons, and these were their names: Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah and Hanan. All these were the sons of Azel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Eshek his brother were Ulam his firstborn, Jeush the second and Eliphelet the third.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ulam were mighty men of valor, archers, and had many sons and grandsons, 150 of them. All these were of the sons of Benjamin.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all Israel was enrolled by genealogies; and behold, they are written in the Book of the Kings of Israel. And Judah was carried away into exile to Babylon for their unfaithfulness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the first who lived in their possessions in their cities were Israel, the priests, the Levites and the temple servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of the sons of Judah, of the sons of Benjamin and of the sons of Ephraim and Manasseh lived in Jerusalem:
speaker: Narrator

text: Uthai the son of Ammihud, the son of Omri, the son of Imri, the son of Bani, from the sons of Perez the son of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the Shilonites were Asaiah the firstborn and his sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the sons of Zerah were Jeuel and their relatives, 690 of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the sons of Benjamin were Sallu the son of Meshullam, the son of Hodaviah, the son of Hassenuah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Ibneiah the son of Jeroham, and Elah the son of Uzzi, the son of Michri, and Meshullam the son of Shephatiah, the son of Reuel, the son of Ibnijah;
speaker: Narrator

text: and their relatives according to their generations, 956. All these were heads of fathers’ households according to their fathers’ houses.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the priests were Jedaiah, Jehoiarib, Jachin,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Azariah the son of Hilkiah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Zadok, the son of Meraioth, the son of Ahitub, the chief officer of the house of God;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Adaiah the son of Jeroham, the son of Pashhur, the son of Malchijah, and Maasai the son of Adiel, the son of Jahzerah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Meshillemith, the son of Immer;
speaker: Narrator

text: and their relatives, heads of their fathers’ households, 1,760 very able men for the work of the service of the house of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the Levites were Shemaiah the son of Hasshub, the son of Azrikam, the son of Hashabiah, of the sons of Merari;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Bakbakkar, Heresh and Galal and Mattaniah the son of Mica, the son of Zichri, the son of Asaph,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Obadiah the son of Shemaiah, the son of Galal, the son of Jeduthun, and Berechiah the son of Asa, the son of Elkanah, who lived in the villages of the Netophathites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the gatekeepers were Shallum and Akkub and Talmon and Ahiman and their relatives (Shallum the chief
speaker: Narrator

text: being stationed until now at the king’s gate to the east). These were the gatekeepers for the camp of the sons of Levi.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shallum the son of Kore, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah, and his relatives of his father’s house, the Korahites, were over the work of the service, keepers of the thresholds of the tent; and their fathers had been over the camp of the Lord, keepers of the entrance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Phinehas the son of Eleazar was ruler over them previously, and the Lord was with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zechariah the son of Meshelemiah was gatekeeper of the entrance of the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these who were chosen to be gatekeepers at the thresholds were 212. These were enrolled by genealogy in their villages, whom David and Samuel the seer appointed in their office of trust.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they and their sons had charge of the gates of the house of the Lord, even the house of the tent, as guards.
speaker: Narrator

text: The gatekeepers were on the four sides, to the east, west, north and south.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their relatives in their villages were to come in every seven days from time to time to be with them;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the four chief gatekeepers who were Levites, were in an office of trust, and were over the chambers and over the treasuries in the house of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: They spent the night around the house of God, because the watch was committed to them; and they were in charge of opening it morning by morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now some of them had charge of the utensils of service, for they counted them when they brought them in and when they took them out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of them also were appointed over the furniture and over all the utensils of the sanctuary and over the fine flour and the wine and the oil and the frankincense and the spices.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of the sons of the priests prepared the mixing of the spices.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mattithiah, one of the Levites, who was the firstborn of Shallum the Korahite, had the responsibility over the things which were baked in pans.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of their relatives of the sons of the Kohathites were over the showbread to prepare it every sabbath.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the singers, heads of fathers’ households of the Levites, who lived in the chambers of the temple free from other service; for they were engaged in their work day and night.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were heads of fathers’ households of the Levites according to their generations, chief men, who lived in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: In Gibeon Jeiel the father of Gibeon lived, and his wife’s name was Maacah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and his firstborn son was Abdon, then Zur, Kish, Baal, Ner, Nadab,
speaker: Narrator

text: Gedor, Ahio, Zechariah and Mikloth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mikloth became the father of Shimeam. And they also lived with their relatives in Jerusalem opposite their other relatives.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ner became the father of Kish, and Kish became the father of Saul, and Saul became the father of Jonathan, Malchi-shua, Abinadab and Eshbaal.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Jonathan was Merib-baal; and Merib-baal became the father of Micah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Micah were Pithon, Melech, Tahrea and Ahaz.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahaz became the father of Jarah, and Jarah became the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth and Zimri; and Zimri became the father of Moza,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Moza became the father of Binea and Rephaiah his son, Eleasah his son, Azel his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Azel had six sons whose names are these: Azrikam, Bocheru and Ishmael and Sheariah and Obadiah and Hanan. These were the sons of Azel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Philistines fought against Israel; and the men of Israel fled before the Philistines and fell slain on Mount Gilboa.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Philistines closely pursued Saul and his sons, and the Philistines struck down Jonathan, Abinadab and Malchi-shua, the sons of Saul.
speaker: Narrator

text: The battle became heavy against Saul, and the archers overtook him; and he was wounded by the archers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Saul said to his armor bearer, “Draw your sword and thrust me through with it, otherwise these uncircumcised will come and abuse me.” But his armor bearer would not, for he was greatly afraid. Therefore Saul took his sword and fell on it.
speaker: Narrator

text: When his armor bearer saw that Saul was dead, he likewise fell on his sword and died.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus Saul died with his three sons, and all those of his house died together.
speaker: Narrator

text: When all the men of Israel who were in the valley saw that they had fled, and that Saul and his sons were dead, they forsook their cities and fled; and the Philistines came and lived in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: It came about the next day, when the Philistines came to strip the slain, that they found Saul and his sons fallen on Mount Gilboa.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they stripped him and took his head and his armor and sent messengers around the land of the Philistines to carry the good news to their idols and to the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: They put his armor in the house of their gods and fastened his head in the house of Dagon.
speaker: Narrator

text: When all Jabesh-gilead heard all that the Philistines had done to Saul,
speaker: Narrator

text: all the valiant men arose and took away the body of Saul and the bodies of his sons and brought them to Jabesh, and they buried their bones under the oak in Jabesh, and fasted seven days.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Saul died for his trespass which he committed against the Lord, because of the word of the Lord which he did not keep; and also because he asked counsel of a medium, making inquiry of it,
speaker: Narrator

text: and did not inquire of the Lord. Therefore He killed him and turned the kingdom to David the son of Jesse.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all Israel gathered to David at Hebron and said, “Behold, we are your bone and your flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: In times past, even when Saul was king, you were the one who led out and brought in Israel; and the Lord your God said to you, ‘You shall shepherd My people Israel, and you shall be prince over My people Israel.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the elders of Israel came to the king at Hebron, and David made a covenant with them in Hebron before the Lord; and they anointed David king over Israel, according to the word of the Lord through Samuel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David and all Israel went to Jerusalem (that is, Jebus); and the Jebusites, the inhabitants of the land, were there.
speaker: Narrator

text: The inhabitants of Jebus said to David, “You shall not enter here.” Nevertheless David captured the stronghold of Zion (that is, the city of David).
speaker: Narrator

text: Now David had said, “Whoever strikes down a Jebusite first shall be chief and commander.” Joab the son of Zeruiah went up first, so he became chief.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David dwelt in the stronghold; therefore it was called the city of David.
speaker: Narrator

text: He built the city all around, from the Millo even to the surrounding area; and Joab repaired the rest of the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: David became greater and greater, for the Lord of hosts was with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the heads of the mighty men whom David had, who gave him strong support in his kingdom, together with all Israel, to make him king, according to the word of the Lord concerning Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: These constitute the list of the mighty men whom David had: Jashobeam, the son of a Hachmonite, the chief of the thirty; he lifted up his spear against three hundred whom he killed at one time.
speaker: Narrator

text: After him was Eleazar the son of Dodo, the Ahohite, who was one of the three mighty men.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was with David at Pasdammim when the Philistines were gathered together there to battle, and there was a plot of ground full of barley; and the people fled before the Philistines.
speaker: Narrator

text: They took their stand in the midst of the plot and defended it, and struck down the Philistines; and the Lord saved them by a great victory.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now three of the thirty chief men went down to the rock to David, into the cave of Adullam, while the army of the Philistines was camping in the valley of Rephaim.
speaker: Narrator

text: David was then in the stronghold, while the garrison of the Philistines was then in Bethlehem.
speaker: Narrator

text: David had a craving and said, “Oh that someone would give me water to drink from the well of Bethlehem, which is by the gate!”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the three broke through the camp of the Philistines and drew water from the well of Bethlehem which was by the gate, and took it and brought it to David; nevertheless David would not drink it, but poured it out to the Lord;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he said, “Be it far from me before my God that I should do this. Shall I drink the blood of these men who went at the risk of their lives? For at the risk of their lives they brought it.” Therefore he would not drink it. These things the three mighty men did.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for Abshai the brother of Joab, he was chief of the thirty, and he swung his spear against three hundred and killed them; and he had a name as well as the thirty.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the three in the second rank he was the most honored and became their commander; however, he did not attain to the first three.
speaker: Narrator

text: Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, the son of a valiant man of Kabzeel, mighty in deeds, struck down the two sons of Ariel of Moab. He also went down and killed a lion inside a pit on a snowy day.
speaker: Narrator

text: He killed an Egyptian, a man of great stature five cubits tall. Now in the Egyptian’s hand was a spear like a weaver’s beam, but he went down to him with a club and snatched the spear from the Egyptian’s hand and killed him with his own spear.
speaker: Narrator

text: These things Benaiah the son of Jehoiada did, and had a name as well as the three mighty men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, he was honored among the thirty, but he did not attain to the three; and David appointed him over his guard.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the mighty men of the armies were Asahel the brother of Joab, Elhanan the son of Dodo of Bethlehem,
speaker: Narrator

text: Shammoth the Harorite, Helez the Pelonite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite, Abiezer the Anathothite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Sibbecai the Hushathite, Ilai the Ahohite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Maharai the Netophathite, Heled the son of Baanah the Netophathite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ithai the son of Ribai of Gibeah of the sons of Benjamin, Benaiah the Pirathonite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hurai of the brooks of Gaash, Abiel the Arbathite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Azmaveth the Baharumite, Eliahba the Shaalbonite,
speaker: Narrator

text: the sons of Hashem the Gizonite, Jonathan the son of Shagee the Hararite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahiam the son of Sacar the Hararite, Eliphal the son of Ur,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hepher the Mecherathite, Ahijah the Pelonite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hezro the Carmelite, Naarai the son of Ezbai,
speaker: Narrator

text: Joel the brother of Nathan, Mibhar the son of Hagri,
speaker: Narrator

text: Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai the Berothite, the armor bearer of Joab the son of Zeruiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Uriah the Hittite, Zabad the son of Ahlai,
speaker: Narrator

text: Adina the son of Shiza the Reubenite, a chief of the Reubenites, and thirty with him,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hanan the son of Maacah and Joshaphat the Mithnite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Uzzia the Ashterathite, Shama and Jeiel the sons of Hotham the Aroerite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jediael the son of Shimri and Joha his brother, the Tizite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eliel the Mahavite and Jeribai and Joshaviah, the sons of Elnaam, and Ithmah the Moabite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eliel and Obed and Jaasiel the Mezobaite.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the ones who came to David at Ziklag, while he was still restricted because of Saul the son of Kish; and they were among the mighty men who helped him in war.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were equipped with bows, using both the right hand and the left to sling stones and to shoot arrows from the bow; they were Saul’s kinsmen from Benjamin.
speaker: Narrator

text: The chief was Ahiezer, then Joash, the sons of Shemaah the Gibeathite; and Jeziel and Pelet, the sons of Azmaveth, and Beracah and Jehu the Anathothite,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Ishmaiah the Gibeonite, a mighty man among the thirty, and over the thirty. Then Jeremiah, Jahaziel, Johanan, Jozabad the Gederathite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eluzai, Jerimoth, Bealiah, Shemariah, Shephatiah the Haruphite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elkanah, Isshiah, Azarel, Joezer, Jashobeam, the Korahites,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Joelah and Zebadiah, the sons of Jeroham of Gedor.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the Gadites there came over to David in the stronghold in the wilderness, mighty men of valor, men trained for war, who could handle shield and spear, and whose faces were like the faces of lions, and they were as swift as the gazelles on the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ezer was the first, Obadiah the second, Eliab the third,
speaker: Narrator

text: Mishmannah the fourth, Jeremiah the fifth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Attai the sixth, Eliel the seventh,
speaker: Narrator

text: Johanan the eighth, Elzabad the ninth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jeremiah the tenth, Machbannai the eleventh.
speaker: Narrator

text: These of the sons of Gad were captains of the army; he who was least was equal to a hundred and the greatest to a thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the ones who crossed the Jordan in the first month when it was overflowing all its banks and they put to flight all those in the valleys, both to the east and to the west.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then some of the sons of Benjamin and Judah came to the stronghold to David.
speaker: Narrator

text: David went out to meet them, and said to them, “If you come peacefully to me to help me, my heart shall be united with you; but if to betray me to my adversaries, since there is no wrong in my hands, may the God of our fathers look on it and decide.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then the Spirit came upon Amasai, who was the chief of the thirty, and he said,
“We are yours, O David,
And with you, O son of Jesse!
Peace, peace to you,
And peace to him who helps you;
Indeed, your God helps you!”
Then David received them and made them captains of the band.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Manasseh also some defected to David when he was about to go to battle with the Philistines against Saul. But they did not help them, for the lords of the Philistines after consultation sent him away, saying, “At the cost of our heads he may defect to his master Saul.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As he went to Ziklag there defected to him from Manasseh: Adnah, Jozabad, Jediael, Michael, Jozabad, Elihu and Zillethai, captains of thousands who belonged to Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: They helped David against the band of raiders, for they were all mighty men of valor, and were captains in the army.
speaker: Narrator

text: For day by day men came to David to help him, until there was a great army like the army of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the numbers of the divisions equipped for war, who came to David at Hebron, to turn the kingdom of Saul to him, according to the word of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Judah who bore shield and spear were 6,800, equipped for war.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the sons of Simeon, mighty men of valor for war, 7,100.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the sons of Levi 4,600.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Jehoiada was the leader of the house of Aaron, and with him were 3,700,
speaker: Narrator

text: also Zadok, a young man mighty of valor, and of his father’s house twenty-two captains.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the sons of Benjamin, Saul’s kinsmen, 3,000; for until now the greatest part of them had kept their allegiance to the house of Saul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the sons of Ephraim 20,800, mighty men of valor, famous men in their fathers’ households.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the half-tribe of Manasseh 18,000, who were designated by name to come and make David king.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the sons of Issachar, men who understood the times, with knowledge of what Israel should do, their chiefs were two hundred; and all their kinsmen were at their command.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Zebulun, there were 50,000 who went out in the army, who could draw up in battle formation with all kinds of weapons of war and helped David with an undivided heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Naphtali there were 1,000 captains, and with them 37,000 with shield and spear.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the Danites who could draw up in battle formation, there were 28,600.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Asher there were 40,000 who went out in the army to draw up in battle formation.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the other side of the Jordan, of the Reubenites and the Gadites and of the half-tribe of Manasseh, there were 120,000 with all kinds of weapons of war for the battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these, being men of war who could draw up in battle formation, came to Hebron with a perfect heart to make David king over all Israel; and all the rest also of Israel were of one mind to make David king.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were there with David three days, eating and drinking, for their kinsmen had prepared for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover those who were near to them, even as far as Issachar and Zebulun and Naphtali, brought food on donkeys, camels, mules and on oxen, great quantities of flour cakes, fig cakes and bunches of raisins, wine, oil, oxen and sheep. There was joy indeed in Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David consulted with the captains of the thousands and the hundreds, even with every leader.
speaker: Narrator

text: David said to all the assembly of Israel, “If it seems good to you, and if it is from the Lord our God, let us send everywhere to our kinsmen who remain in all the land of Israel, also to the priests and Levites who are with them in their cities with pasture lands, that they may meet with us;
speaker: Narrator

text: and let us bring back the ark of our God to us, for we did not seek it in the days of Saul.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all the assembly said that they would do so, for the thing was right in the eyes of all the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: So David assembled all Israel together, from the Shihor of Egypt even to the entrance of Hamath, to bring the ark of God from Kiriath-jearim.
speaker: Narrator

text: David and all Israel went up to Baalah, that is, to Kiriath-jearim, which belongs to Judah, to bring up from there the ark of God, the Lord who is enthroned above the cherubim, where His name is called.
speaker: Narrator

text: They carried the ark of God on a new cart from the house of Abinadab, and Uzza and Ahio drove the cart.
speaker: Narrator

text: David and all Israel were celebrating before God with all their might, even with songs and with lyres, harps, tambourines, cymbals and with trumpets.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they came to the threshing floor of Chidon, Uzza put out his hand to hold the ark, because the oxen nearly upset it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The anger of the Lord burned against Uzza, so He struck him down because he put out his hand to the ark; and he died there before God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David became angry because of the Lord’s outburst against Uzza; and he called that place Perez-uzza to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: David was afraid of God that day, saying, “How can I bring the ark of God home to me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So David did not take the ark with him to the city of David, but took it aside to the house of Obed-edom the Gittite.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus the ark of God remained with the family of Obed-edom in his house three months; and the Lord blessed the family of Obed-edom with all that he had.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Hiram king of Tyre sent messengers to David with cedar trees, masons and carpenters, to build a house for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David realized that the Lord had established him as king over Israel, and that his kingdom was highly exalted, for the sake of His people Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David took more wives at Jerusalem, and David became the father of more sons and daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the names of the children born to him in Jerusalem: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ibhar, Elishua, Elpelet,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elishama, Beeliada and Eliphelet.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Philistines heard that David had been anointed king over all Israel, all the Philistines went up in search of David; and David heard of it and went out against them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Philistines had come and made a raid in the valley of Rephaim.
speaker: Narrator

text: David inquired of God, saying, “Shall I go up against the Philistines? And will You give them into my hand?” Then the Lord said to him, “Go up, for I will give them into your hand.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they came up to Baal-perazim, and David defeated them there; and David said, “God has broken through my enemies by my hand, like the breakthrough of waters.” Therefore they named that place Baal-perazim.
speaker: Narrator

text: They abandoned their gods there; so David gave the order and they were burned with fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Philistines made yet another raid in the valley.
speaker: Narrator

text: David inquired again of God, and God said to him, “You shall not go up after them; circle around behind them and come at them in front of the balsam trees.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be when you hear the sound of marching in the tops of the balsam trees, then you shall go out to battle, for God will have gone out before you to strike the army of the Philistines.”
speaker: Narrator

text: David did just as God had commanded him, and they struck down the army of the Philistines from Gibeon even as far as Gezer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the fame of David went out into all the lands; and the Lord brought the fear of him on all the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now David built houses for himself in the city of David; and he prepared a place for the ark of God and pitched a tent for it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David said, “No one is to carry the ark of God but the Levites; for the Lord chose them to carry the ark of God and to minister to Him forever.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And David assembled all Israel at Jerusalem to bring up the ark of the Lord to its place which he had prepared for it.
speaker: Narrator

text: David gathered together the sons of Aaron and the Levites:
speaker: Narrator

text: of the sons of Kohath, Uriel the chief, and 120 of his relatives;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the sons of Merari, Asaiah the chief, and 220 of his relatives;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the sons of Gershom, Joel the chief, and 130 of his relatives;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the sons of Elizaphan, Shemaiah the chief, and 200 of his relatives;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the sons of Hebron, Eliel the chief, and 80 of his relatives;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the sons of Uzziel, Amminadab the chief, and 112 of his relatives.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David called for Zadok and Abiathar the priests, and for the Levites, for Uriel, Asaiah, Joel, Shemaiah, Eliel and Amminadab,
speaker: Narrator

text: and said to them, “You are the heads of the fathers’ households of the Levites; consecrate yourselves both you and your relatives, that you may bring up the ark of the Lord God of Israel to the place that I have prepared for it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because you did not carry it at the first, the Lord our God made an outburst on us, for we did not seek Him according to the ordinance.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the priests and the Levites consecrated themselves to bring up the ark of the Lord God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of the Levites carried the ark of God on their shoulders with the poles thereon, as Moses had commanded according to the word of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David spoke to the chiefs of the Levites to appoint their relatives the singers, with instruments of music, harps, lyres, loud-sounding cymbals, to raise sounds of joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Levites appointed Heman the son of Joel, and from his relatives, Asaph the son of Berechiah; and from the sons of Merari their relatives, Ethan the son of Kushaiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and with them their relatives of the second rank, Zechariah, Ben, Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed-edom and Jeiel, the gatekeepers.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the singers, Heman, Asaph and Ethan were appointed to sound aloud cymbals of bronze;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Zechariah, Aziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Maaseiah and Benaiah, with harps tuned to alamoth;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed-edom, Jeiel and Azaziah, to lead with lyres tuned to the sheminith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Chenaniah, chief of the Levites, was in charge of the singing; he gave instruction in singing because he was skillful.
speaker: Narrator

text: Berechiah and Elkanah were gatekeepers for the ark.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shebaniah, Joshaphat, Nethanel, Amasai, Zechariah, Benaiah and Eliezer, the priests, blew the trumpets before the ark of God. Obed-edom and Jehiah also were gatekeepers for the ark.
speaker: Narrator

text: So it was David, with the elders of Israel and the captains over thousands, who went to bring up the ark of the covenant of the Lord from the house of Obed-edom with joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because God was helping the Levites who were carrying the ark of the covenant of the Lord, they sacrificed seven bulls and seven rams.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now David was clothed with a robe of fine linen with all the Levites who were carrying the ark, and the singers and Chenaniah the leader of the singing with the singers. David also wore an ephod of linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus all Israel brought up the ark of the covenant of the Lord with shouting, and with sound of the horn, with trumpets, with loud-sounding cymbals, with harps and lyres.
speaker: Narrator

text: It happened when the ark of the covenant of the Lord came to the city of David, that Michal the daughter of Saul looked out of the window and saw King David leaping and celebrating; and she despised him in her heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they brought in the ark of God and placed it inside the tent which David had pitched for it, and they offered burnt offerings and peace offerings before God.
speaker: Narrator

text: When David had finished offering the burnt offering and the peace offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: He distributed to everyone of Israel, both man and woman, to everyone a loaf of bread and a portion of meat and a raisin cake.
speaker: Narrator

text: He appointed some of the Levites as ministers before the ark of the Lord, even to celebrate and to thank and praise the Lord God of Israel:
speaker: Narrator

text: Asaph the chief, and second to him Zechariah, then Jeiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, Obed-edom and Jeiel, with musical instruments, harps, lyres; also Asaph played loud-sounding cymbals,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Benaiah and Jahaziel the priests blew trumpets continually before the ark of the covenant of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then on that day David first assigned Asaph and his relatives to give thanks to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh give thanks to the Lord, call upon His name;
Make known His deeds among the peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to Him, sing praises to Him;
Speak of all His wonders.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Glory in His holy name;
Let the heart of those who seek the Lord be glad.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Seek the Lord and His strength;
Seek His face continually.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember His wonderful deeds which He has done,
His marvels and the judgments from His mouth,
speaker: Narrator

text:
O seed of Israel His servant,
Sons of Jacob, His chosen ones!
speaker: Narrator

text:
He is the Lord our God;
His judgments are in all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember His covenant forever,
The word which He commanded to a thousand generations,
speaker: Narrator

text:
The covenant which He made with Abraham,
And His oath to Isaac.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He also confirmed it to Jacob for a statute,
To Israel as an everlasting covenant,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Saying, “To you I will give the land of Canaan,
As the portion of your inheritance.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
When they were only a few in number,
Very few, and strangers in it,
speaker: Narrator

text:
And they wandered about from nation to nation,
And from one kingdom to another people,
speaker: Narrator

text:
He permitted no man to oppress them,
And He reproved kings for their sakes, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Do not touch My anointed ones,
And do My prophets no harm.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to the Lord, all the earth;
Proclaim good tidings of His salvation from day to day.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Tell of His glory among the nations,
His wonderful deeds among all the peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For great is the Lord, and greatly to be praised;
He also is to be feared above all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For all the gods of the peoples are idols,
But the Lord made the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Splendor and majesty are before Him,
Strength and joy are in His place.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ascribe to the Lord, O families of the peoples,
Ascribe to the Lord glory and strength.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Tremble before Him, all the earth;
Indeed, the world is firmly established, it will not be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice;
And let them say among the nations, “The Lord reigns.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the sea roar, and all it contains;
Let the field exult, and all that is in it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then the trees of the forest will sing for joy before the Lord;
For He is coming to judge the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O give thanks to the Lord, for He is good;
For His lovingkindness is everlasting.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then say, “Save us, O God of our salvation,
And gather us and deliver us from the nations,
To give thanks to Your holy name,
And glory in Your praise.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel,
From everlasting even to everlasting.
Then all the people said, “Amen,” and praised the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he left Asaph and his relatives there before the ark of the covenant of the Lord to minister before the ark continually, as every day’s work required;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Obed-edom with his 68 relatives; Obed-edom, also the son of Jeduthun, and Hosah as gatekeepers.
speaker: Narrator

text: He left Zadok the priest and his relatives the priests before the tabernacle of the Lord in the high place which was at Gibeon,
speaker: Narrator

text: to offer burnt offerings to the Lord on the altar of burnt offering continually morning and evening, even according to all that is written in the law of the Lord, which He commanded Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: With them were Heman and Jeduthun, and the rest who were chosen, who were designated by name, to give thanks to the Lord, because His lovingkindness is everlasting.
speaker: Narrator

text: And with them were Heman and Jeduthun with trumpets and cymbals for those who should sound aloud, and with instruments for the songs of God, and the sons of Jeduthun for the gate.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all the people departed each to his house, and David returned to bless his household.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came about, when David dwelt in his house, that David said to Nathan the prophet, “Behold, I am dwelling in a house of cedar, but the ark of the covenant of the Lord is under curtains.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Nathan said to David, “Do all that is in your heart, for God is with you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: It came about the same night that the word of God came to Nathan, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Go and tell David My servant, ‘Thus says the Lord, “You shall not build a house for Me to dwell in;
speaker: Narrator

text: for I have not dwelt in a house since the day that I brought up Israel to this day, but I have gone from tent to tent and from one dwelling place to another.
speaker: Narrator

text: In all places where I have walked with all Israel, have I spoken a word with any of the judges of Israel, whom I commanded to shepherd My people, saying, ‘Why have you not built for Me a house of cedar?’”’
speaker: Narrator

text: Now, therefore, thus shall you say to My servant David, ‘Thus says the Lord of hosts, “I took you from the pasture, from following the sheep, to be leader over My people Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have been with you wherever you have gone, and have cut off all your enemies from before you; and I will make you a name like the name of the great ones who are in the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will appoint a place for My people Israel, and will plant them, so that they may dwell in their own place and not be moved again; and the wicked will not waste them anymore as formerly,
speaker: Narrator

text:
even from the day that I commanded judges to be over My people Israel. And I will subdue all your enemies.
Moreover, I tell you that the Lord will build a house for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: When your days are fulfilled that you must go to be with your fathers, that I will set up one of your descendants after you, who will be of your sons; and I will establish his kingdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall build for Me a house, and I will establish his throne forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will be his father and he shall be My son; and I will not take My lovingkindness away from him, as I took it from him who was before you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I will settle him in My house and in My kingdom forever, and his throne shall be established forever.”’”
speaker: Narrator

text: According to all these words and according to all this vision, so Nathan spoke to David.
speaker: Narrator
