text: Then David the king went in and sat before the Lord and said, “Who am I, O Lord God, and what is my house that You have brought me this far?
speaker: Narrator

text: This was a small thing in Your eyes, O God; but You have spoken of Your servant’s house for a great while to come, and have regarded me according to the standard of a man of high degree, O Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: What more can David still say to You concerning the honor bestowed on Your servant? For You know Your servant.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, for Your servant’s sake, and according to Your own heart, You have wrought all this greatness, to make known all these great things.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, there is none like You, nor is there any God besides You, according to all that we have heard with our ears.
speaker: Narrator

text: And what one nation in the earth is like Your people Israel, whom God went to redeem for Himself as a people, to make You a name by great and terrible things, in driving out nations from before Your people, whom You redeemed out of Egypt?
speaker: Narrator

text: For Your people Israel You made Your own people forever, and You, O Lord, became their God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now, O Lord, let the word that You have spoken concerning Your servant and concerning his house be established forever, and do as You have spoken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let Your name be established and magnified forever, saying, ‘The Lord of hosts is the God of Israel, even a God to Israel; and the house of David Your servant is established before You.’
speaker: Narrator

text: For You, O my God, have revealed to Your servant that You will build for him a house; therefore Your servant has found courage to pray before You.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now, O Lord, You are God, and have promised this good thing to Your servant.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now it has pleased You to bless the house of Your servant, that it may continue forever before You; for You, O Lord, have blessed, and it is blessed forever.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now after this it came about that David defeated the Philistines and subdued them and took Gath and its towns from the hand of the Philistines.
speaker: Narrator

text: He defeated Moab, and the Moabites became servants to David, bringing tribute.
speaker: Narrator

text: David also defeated Hadadezer king of Zobah as far as Hamath, as he went to establish his rule to the Euphrates River.
speaker: Narrator

text: David took from him 1,000 chariots and 7,000 horsemen and 20,000 foot soldiers, and David hamstrung all the chariot horses, but reserved enough of them for 100 chariots.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Arameans of Damascus came to help Hadadezer king of Zobah, David killed 22,000 men of the Arameans.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David put garrisons among the Arameans of Damascus; and the Arameans became servants to David, bringing tribute. And the Lord helped David wherever he went.
speaker: Narrator

text: David took the shields of gold which were carried by the servants of Hadadezer and brought them to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also from Tibhath and from Cun, cities of Hadadezer, David took a very large amount of bronze, with which Solomon made the bronze sea and the pillars and the bronze utensils.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Tou king of Hamath heard that David had defeated all the army of Hadadezer king of Zobah,
speaker: Narrator

text: he sent Hadoram his son to King David to greet him and to bless him, because he had fought against Hadadezer and had defeated him; for Hadadezer had been at war with Tou. And Hadoram brought all kinds of articles of gold and silver and bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text: King David also dedicated these to the Lord with the silver and the gold which he had carried away from all the nations: from Edom, Moab, the sons of Ammon, the Philistines, and from Amalek.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover Abishai the son of Zeruiah defeated 18,000 Edomites in the Valley of Salt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he put garrisons in Edom, and all the Edomites became servants to David. And the Lord helped David wherever he went.
speaker: Narrator

text: So David reigned over all Israel; and he administered justice and righteousness for all his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joab the son of Zeruiah was over the army, and Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud was recorder;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Zadok the son of Ahitub and Abimelech the son of Abiathar were priests, and Shavsha was secretary;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and the Pelethites, and the sons of David were chiefs at the king’s side.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now it came about after this, that Nahash the king of the sons of Ammon died, and his son became king in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David said, “I will show kindness to Hanun the son of Nahash, because his father showed kindness to me.” So David sent messengers to console him concerning his father. And David’s servants came into the land of the sons of Ammon to Hanun to console him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the princes of the sons of Ammon said to Hanun, “Do you think that David is honoring your father, in that he has sent comforters to you? Have not his servants come to you to search and to overthrow and to spy out the land?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Hanun took David’s servants and shaved them and cut off their garments in the middle as far as their hips, and sent them away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then certain persons went and told David about the men. And he sent to meet them, for the men were greatly humiliated. And the king said, “Stay at Jericho until your beards grow, and then return.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the sons of Ammon saw that they had made themselves odious to David, Hanun and the sons of Ammon sent 1,000 talents of silver to hire for themselves chariots and horsemen from Mesopotamia, from Aram-maacah and from Zobah.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they hired for themselves 32,000 chariots, and the king of Maacah and his people, who came and camped before Medeba. And the sons of Ammon gathered together from their cities and came to battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: When David heard of it, he sent Joab and all the army, the mighty men.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ammon came out and drew up in battle array at the entrance of the city, and the kings who had come were by themselves in the field.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Joab saw that the battle was set against him in front and in the rear, he selected from all the choice men of Israel and they arrayed themselves against the Arameans.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the remainder of the people he placed in the hand of Abshai his brother; and they arrayed themselves against the sons of Ammon.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “If the Arameans are too strong for me, then you shall help me; but if the sons of Ammon are too strong for you, then I will help you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be strong, and let us show ourselves courageous for the sake of our people and for the cities of our God; and may the Lord do what is good in His sight.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joab and the people who were with him drew near to the battle against the Arameans, and they fled before him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the sons of Ammon saw that the Arameans fled, they also fled before Abshai his brother and entered the city. Then Joab came to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Arameans saw that they had been defeated by Israel, they sent messengers and brought out the Arameans who were beyond the River, with Shophach the commander of the army of Hadadezer leading them.
speaker: Narrator

text: When it was told David, he gathered all Israel together and crossed the Jordan, and came upon them and drew up in formation against them. And when David drew up in battle array against the Arameans, they fought against him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Arameans fled before Israel, and David killed of the Arameans 7,000 charioteers and 40,000 foot soldiers, and put to death Shophach the commander of the army.
speaker: Narrator

text: So when the servants of Hadadezer saw that they were defeated by Israel, they made peace with David and served him. Thus the Arameans were not willing to help the sons of Ammon anymore.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then it happened in the spring, at the time when kings go out to battle, that Joab led out the army and ravaged the land of the sons of Ammon, and came and besieged Rabbah. But David stayed at Jerusalem. And Joab struck Rabbah and overthrew it.
speaker: Narrator

text: David took the crown of their king from his head, and he found it to weigh a talent of gold, and there was a precious stone in it; and it was placed on David’s head. And he brought out the spoil of the city, a very great amount.
speaker: Narrator

text: He brought out the people who were in it, and cut them with saws and with sharp instruments and with axes. And thus David did to all the cities of the sons of Ammon. Then David and all the people returned to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now it came about after this, that war broke out at Gezer with the Philistines; then Sibbecai the Hushathite killed Sippai, one of the descendants of the giants, and they were subdued.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there was war with the Philistines again, and Elhanan the son of Jair killed Lahmi the brother of Goliath the Gittite, the shaft of whose spear was like a weaver’s beam.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again there was war at Gath, where there was a man of great stature who had twenty-four fingers and toes, six fingers on each hand and six toes on each foot; and he also was descended from the giants.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he taunted Israel, Jonathan the son of Shimea, David’s brother, killed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were descended from the giants in Gath, and they fell by the hand of David and by the hand of his servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Satan stood up against Israel and moved David to number Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: So David said to Joab and to the princes of the people, “Go, number Israel from Beersheba even to Dan, and bring me word that I may know their number.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Joab said, “May the Lord add to His people a hundred times as many as they are! But, my lord the king, are they not all my lord’s servants? Why does my lord seek this thing? Why should he be a cause of guilt to Israel?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless, the king’s word prevailed against Joab. Therefore, Joab departed and went throughout all Israel, and came to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joab gave the number of the census of all the people to David. And all Israel were 1,100,000 men who drew the sword; and Judah was 470,000 men who drew the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he did not number Levi and Benjamin among them, for the king’s command was abhorrent to Joab.
speaker: Narrator

text: God was displeased with this thing, so He struck Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: David said to God, “I have sinned greatly, in that I have done this thing. But now, please take away the iniquity of Your servant, for I have done very foolishly.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Gad, David’s seer, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Go and speak to David, saying, ‘Thus says the Lord, “I offer you three things; choose for yourself one of them, which I will do to you.”’”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Gad came to David and said to him, “Thus says the Lord, ‘Take for yourself
speaker: Narrator

text: either three years of famine, or three months to be swept away before your foes, while the sword of your enemies overtakes you, or else three days of the sword of the Lord, even pestilence in the land, and the angel of the Lord destroying throughout all the territory of Israel.’ Now, therefore, consider what answer I shall return to Him who sent me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: David said to Gad, “I am in great distress; please let me fall into the hand of the Lord, for His mercies are very great. But do not let me fall into the hand of man.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Lord sent a pestilence on Israel; 70,000 men of Israel fell.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God sent an angel to Jerusalem to destroy it; but as he was about to destroy it, the Lord saw and was sorry over the calamity, and said to the destroying angel, “It is enough; now relax your hand.” And the angel of the Lord was standing by the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David lifted up his eyes and saw the angel of the Lord standing between earth and heaven, with his drawn sword in his hand stretched out over Jerusalem. Then David and the elders, covered with sackcloth, fell on their faces.
speaker: Narrator

text: David said to God, “Is it not I who commanded to count the people? Indeed, I am the one who has sinned and done very wickedly, but these sheep, what have they done? O Lord my God, please let Your hand be against me and my father’s household, but not against Your people that they should be plagued.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the angel of the Lord commanded Gad to say to David, that David should go up and build an altar to the Lord on the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
speaker: Narrator

text: So David went up at the word of Gad, which he spoke in the name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Ornan turned back and saw the angel, and his four sons who were with him hid themselves. And Ornan was threshing wheat.
speaker: Narrator

text: As David came to Ornan, Ornan looked and saw David, and went out from the threshing floor and prostrated himself before David with his face to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David said to Ornan, “Give me the site of this threshing floor, that I may build on it an altar to the Lord; for the full price you shall give it to me, that the plague may be restrained from the people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Ornan said to David, “Take it for yourself; and let my lord the king do what is good in his sight. See, I will give the oxen for burnt offerings and the threshing sledges for wood and the wheat for the grain offering; I will give it all.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But King David said to Ornan, “No, but I will surely buy it for the full price; for I will not take what is yours for the Lord, or offer a burnt offering which costs me nothing.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So David gave Ornan 600 shekels of gold by weight for the site.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David built an altar to the Lord there and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings. And he called to the Lord and He answered him with fire from heaven on the altar of burnt offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord commanded the angel, and he put his sword back in its sheath.
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time, when David saw that the Lord had answered him on the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite, he offered sacrifice there.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the tabernacle of the Lord, which Moses had made in the wilderness, and the altar of burnt offering were in the high place at Gibeon at that time.
speaker: Narrator

text: But David could not go before it to inquire of God, for he was terrified by the sword of the angel of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David said, “This is the house of the Lord God, and this is the altar of burnt offering for Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So David gave orders to gather the foreigners who were in the land of Israel, and he set stonecutters to hew out stones to build the house of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: David prepared large quantities of iron to make the nails for the doors of the gates and for the clamps, and more bronze than could be weighed;
speaker: Narrator

text: and timbers of cedar logs beyond number, for the Sidonians and Tyrians brought large quantities of cedar timber to David.
speaker: Narrator

text: David said, “My son Solomon is young and inexperienced, and the house that is to be built for the Lord shall be exceedingly magnificent, famous and glorious throughout all lands. Therefore now I will make preparation for it.” So David made ample preparations before his death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he called for his son Solomon, and charged him to build a house for the Lord God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: David said to Solomon, “My son, I had intended to build a house to the name of the Lord my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the word of the Lord came to me, saying, ‘You have shed much blood and have waged great wars; you shall not build a house to My name, because you have shed so much blood on the earth before Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, a son will be born to you, who shall be a man of rest; and I will give him rest from all his enemies on every side; for his name shall be Solomon, and I will give peace and quiet to Israel in his days.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall build a house for My name, and he shall be My son and I will be his father; and I will establish the throne of his kingdom over Israel forever.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Now, my son, the Lord be with you that you may be successful, and build the house of the Lord your God just as He has spoken concerning you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only the Lord give you discretion and understanding, and give you charge over Israel, so that you may keep the law of the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you will prosper, if you are careful to observe the statutes and the ordinances which the Lord commanded Moses concerning Israel. Be strong and courageous, do not fear nor be dismayed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now behold, with great pains I have prepared for the house of the Lord 100,000 talents of gold and 1,000,000 talents of silver, and bronze and iron beyond weight, for they are in great quantity; also timber and stone I have prepared, and you may add to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, there are many workmen with you, stonecutters and masons of stone and carpenters, and all men who are skillful in every kind of work.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the gold, the silver and the bronze and the iron there is no limit. Arise and work, and may the Lord be with you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: David also commanded all the leaders of Israel to help his son Solomon, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Is not the Lord your God with you? And has He not given you rest on every side? For He has given the inhabitants of the land into my hand, and the land is subdued before the Lord and before His people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now set your heart and your soul to seek the Lord your God; arise, therefore, and build the sanctuary of the Lord God, so that you may bring the ark of the covenant of the Lord and the holy vessels of God into the house that is to be built for the name of the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when David reached old age, he made his son Solomon king over Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he gathered together all the leaders of Israel with the priests and the Levites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Levites were numbered from thirty years old and upward, and their number by census of men was 38,000.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of these, 24,000 were to oversee the work of the house of the Lord; and 6,000 were officers and judges,
speaker: Narrator

text: and 4,000 were gatekeepers, and 4,000 were praising the Lord with the instruments which David made for giving praise.
speaker: Narrator

text: David divided them into divisions according to the sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the Gershonites were Ladan and Shimei.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ladan were Jehiel the first and Zetham and Joel, three.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shimei were Shelomoth and Haziel and Haran, three. These were the heads of the fathers’ households of Ladan.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shimei were Jahath, Zina, Jeush and Beriah. These four were the sons of Shimei.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jahath was the first and Zizah the second; but Jeush and Beriah did not have many sons, so they became a father’s household, one class.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Kohath were four: Amram, Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Amram were Aaron and Moses. And Aaron was set apart to sanctify him as most holy, he and his sons forever, to burn incense before the Lord, to minister to Him and to bless in His name forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for Moses the man of God, his sons were named among the tribe of Levi.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Moses were Gershom and Eliezer.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Gershom was Shebuel the chief.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Eliezer was Rehabiah the chief; and Eliezer had no other sons, but the sons of Rehabiah were very many.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Izhar was Shelomith the chief.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Hebron were Jeriah the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third and Jekameam the fourth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Uzziel were Micah the first and Isshiah the second.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Merari were Mahli and Mushi. The sons of Mahli were Eleazar and Kish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eleazar died and had no sons, but daughters only, so their brothers, the sons of Kish, took them as wives.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Mushi were three: Mahli, Eder and Jeremoth.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the sons of Levi according to their fathers’ households, even the heads of the fathers’ households of those of them who were counted, in the number of names by their census, doing the work for the service of the house of the Lord, from twenty years old and upward.
speaker: Narrator

text: For David said, “The Lord God of Israel has given rest to His people, and He dwells in Jerusalem forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also, the Levites will no longer need to carry the tabernacle and all its utensils for its service.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For by the last words of David the sons of Levi were numbered from twenty years old and upward.
speaker: Narrator

text: For their office is to assist the sons of Aaron with the service of the house of the Lord, in the courts and in the chambers and in the purifying of all holy things, even the work of the service of the house of God,
speaker: Narrator

text: and with the showbread, and the fine flour for a grain offering, and unleavened wafers, or what is baked in the pan or what is well-mixed, and all measures of volume and size.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are to stand every morning to thank and to praise the Lord, and likewise at evening,
speaker: Narrator

text: and to offer all burnt offerings to the Lord, on the sabbaths, the new moons and the fixed festivals in the number set by the ordinance concerning them, continually before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus they are to keep charge of the tent of meeting, and charge of the holy place, and charge of the sons of Aaron their relatives, for the service of the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the divisions of the descendants of Aaron were these: the sons of Aaron were Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Nadab and Abihu died before their father and had no sons. So Eleazar and Ithamar served as priests.
speaker: Narrator

text: David, with Zadok of the sons of Eleazar and Ahimelech of the sons of Ithamar, divided them according to their offices for their ministry.
speaker: Narrator

text: Since more chief men were found from the descendants of Eleazar than the descendants of Ithamar, they divided them thus: there were sixteen heads of fathers’ households of the descendants of Eleazar and eight of the descendants of Ithamar, according to their fathers’ households.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus they were divided by lot, the one as the other; for they were officers of the sanctuary and officers of God, both from the descendants of Eleazar and the descendants of Ithamar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shemaiah, the son of Nethanel the scribe, from the Levites, recorded them in the presence of the king, the princes, Zadok the priest, Ahimelech the son of Abiathar, and the heads of the fathers’ households of the priests and of the Levites; one father’s household taken for Eleazar and one taken for Ithamar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the first lot came out for Jehoiarib, the second for Jedaiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the third for Harim, the fourth for Seorim,
speaker: Narrator

text: the fifth for Malchijah, the sixth for Mijamin,
speaker: Narrator

text: the seventh for Hakkoz, the eighth for Abijah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the ninth for Jeshua, the tenth for Shecaniah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the eleventh for Eliashib, the twelfth for Jakim,
speaker: Narrator

text: the thirteenth for Huppah, the fourteenth for Jeshebeab,
speaker: Narrator

text: the fifteenth for Bilgah, the sixteenth for Immer,
speaker: Narrator

text: the seventeenth for Hezir, the eighteenth for Happizzez,
speaker: Narrator

text: the nineteenth for Pethahiah, the twentieth for Jehezkel,
speaker: Narrator

text: the twenty-first for Jachin, the twenty-second for Gamul,
speaker: Narrator

text: the twenty-third for Delaiah, the twenty-fourth for Maaziah.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were their offices for their ministry when they came in to the house of the Lord according to the ordinance given to them through Aaron their father, just as the Lord God of Israel had commanded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now for the rest of the sons of Levi: of the sons of Amram, Shubael; of the sons of Shubael, Jehdeiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Rehabiah: of the sons of Rehabiah, Isshiah the first.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the Izharites, Shelomoth; of the sons of Shelomoth, Jahath.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Hebron: Jeriah the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, Jekameam the fourth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the sons of Uzziel, Micah; of the sons of Micah, Shamir.
speaker: Narrator

text: The brother of Micah, Isshiah; of the sons of Isshiah, Zechariah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Merari, Mahli and Mushi; the sons of Jaaziah, Beno.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Merari: by Jaaziah were Beno, Shoham, Zaccur and Ibri.
speaker: Narrator

text: By Mahli: Eleazar, who had no sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: By Kish: the sons of Kish, Jerahmeel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Mushi: Mahli, Eder and Jerimoth. These were the sons of the Levites according to their fathers’ households.
speaker: Narrator

text: These also cast lots just as their relatives the sons of Aaron in the presence of David the king, Zadok, Ahimelech, and the heads of the fathers’ households of the priests and of the Levites—the head of fathers’ households as well as those of his younger brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, David and the commanders of the army set apart for the service some of the sons of Asaph and of Heman and of Jeduthun, who were to prophesy with lyres, harps and cymbals; and the number of those who performed their service was:
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the sons of Asaph: Zaccur, Joseph, Nethaniah and Asharelah; the sons of Asaph were under the direction of Asaph, who prophesied under the direction of the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Jeduthun, the sons of Jeduthun: Gedaliah, Zeri, Jeshaiah, Shimei, Hashabiah and Mattithiah, six, under the direction of their father Jeduthun with the harp, who prophesied in giving thanks and praising the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Heman, the sons of Heman: Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel and Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti and Romamti-ezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, Mahazioth.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these were the sons of Heman the king’s seer to exalt him according to the words of God, for God gave fourteen sons and three daughters to Heman.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these were under the direction of their father to sing in the house of the Lord, with cymbals, harps and lyres, for the service of the house of God. Asaph, Jeduthun and Heman were under the direction of the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their number who were trained in singing to the Lord, with their relatives, all who were skillful, was 288.
speaker: Narrator

text: They cast lots for their duties, all alike, the small as well as the great, the teacher as well as the pupil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the first lot came out for Asaph to Joseph, the second for Gedaliah, he with his relatives and sons were twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the third to Zaccur, his sons and his relatives, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the fourth to Izri, his sons and his relatives, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the fifth to Nethaniah, his sons and his relatives, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the sixth to Bukkiah, his sons and his relatives, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the seventh to Jesharelah, his sons and his relatives, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the eighth to Jeshaiah, his sons and his relatives, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the ninth to Mattaniah, his sons and his relatives, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the tenth to Shimei, his sons and his relatives, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the eleventh to Azarel, his sons and his relatives, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the twelfth to Hashabiah, his sons and his relatives, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the thirteenth, Shubael, his sons and his relatives, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the fourteenth, Mattithiah, his sons and his relatives, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the fifteenth to Jeremoth, his sons and his relatives, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the sixteenth to Hananiah, his sons and his relatives, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the seventeenth to Joshbekashah, his sons and his relatives, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the eighteenth to Hanani, his sons and his relatives, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the nineteenth to Mallothi, his sons and his relatives, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the twentieth to Eliathah, his sons and his relatives, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the twenty-first to Hothir, his sons and his relatives, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the twenty-second to Giddalti, his sons and his relatives, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the twenty-third to Mahazioth, his sons and his relatives, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the twenty-fourth to Romamti-ezer, his sons and his relatives, twelve.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the divisions of the gatekeepers there were of the Korahites, Meshelemiah the son of Kore, of the sons of Asaph.
speaker: Narrator

text: Meshelemiah had sons: Zechariah the firstborn, Jediael the second, Zebadiah the third, Jathniel the fourth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elam the fifth, Johanan the sixth, Eliehoenai the seventh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Obed-edom had sons: Shemaiah the firstborn, Jehozabad the second, Joah the third, Sacar the fourth, Nethanel the fifth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ammiel the sixth, Issachar the seventh and Peullethai the eighth; God had indeed blessed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also to his son Shemaiah sons were born who ruled over the house of their father, for they were mighty men of valor.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shemaiah were Othni, Rephael, Obed and Elzabad, whose brothers, Elihu and Semachiah, were valiant men.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these were of the sons of Obed-edom; they and their sons and their relatives were able men with strength for the service, 62 from Obed-edom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Meshelemiah had sons and relatives, 18 valiant men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also Hosah, one of the sons of Merari had sons: Shimri the first (although he was not the firstborn, his father made him first),
speaker: Narrator

text: Hilkiah the second, Tebaliah the third, Zechariah the fourth; all the sons and relatives of Hosah were 13.
speaker: Narrator

text: To these divisions of the gatekeepers, the chief men, were given duties like their relatives to minister in the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: They cast lots, the small and the great alike, according to their fathers’ households, for every gate.
speaker: Narrator

text: The lot to the east fell to Shelemiah. Then they cast lots for his son Zechariah, a counselor with insight, and his lot came out to the north.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Obed-edom it fell to the south, and to his sons went the storehouse.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Shuppim and Hosah it was to the west, by the gate of Shallecheth, on the ascending highway. Guard corresponded to guard.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the east there were six Levites, on the north four daily, on the south four daily, and at the storehouse two by two.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the Parbar on the west there were four at the highway and two at the Parbar.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the divisions of the gatekeepers of the sons of Korah and of the sons of Merari.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Levites, their relatives, had charge of the treasures of the house of God and of the treasures of the dedicated gifts.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ladan, the sons of the Gershonites belonging to Ladan, namely, the Jehielites, were the heads of the fathers’ households, belonging to Ladan the Gershonite.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jehieli, Zetham and Joel his brother, had charge of the treasures of the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for the Amramites, the Izharites, the Hebronites and the Uzzielites,
speaker: Narrator

text: Shebuel the son of Gershom, the son of Moses, was officer over the treasures.
speaker: Narrator

text: His relatives by Eliezer were Rehabiah his son, Jeshaiah his son, Joram his son, Zichri his son and Shelomoth his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: This Shelomoth and his relatives had charge of all the treasures of the dedicated gifts which King David and the heads of the fathers’ households, the commanders of thousands and hundreds, and the commanders of the army, had dedicated.
speaker: Narrator

text: They dedicated part of the spoil won in battles to repair the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all that Samuel the seer had dedicated and Saul the son of Kish, Abner the son of Ner and Joab the son of Zeruiah, everyone who had dedicated anything, all of this was in the care of Shelomoth and his relatives.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for the Izharites, Chenaniah and his sons were assigned to outside duties for Israel, as officers and judges.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for the Hebronites, Hashabiah and his relatives, 1,700 capable men, had charge of the affairs of Israel west of the Jordan, for all the work of the Lord and the service of the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for the Hebronites, Jerijah the chief (these Hebronites were investigated according to their genealogies and fathers’ households, in the fortieth year of David’s reign, and men of outstanding capability were found among them at Jazer of Gilead)
speaker: Narrator

text: and his relatives, capable men, were 2,700 in number, heads of fathers’ households. And King David made them overseers of the Reubenites, the Gadites and the half-tribe of the Manassites concerning all the affairs of God and of the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now this is the enumeration of the sons of Israel, the heads of fathers’ households, the commanders of thousands and of hundreds, and their officers who served the king in all the affairs of the divisions which came in and went out month by month throughout all the months of the year, each division numbering 24,000:
speaker: Narrator

text: Jashobeam the son of Zabdiel had charge of the first division for the first month; and in his division were 24,000.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was from the sons of Perez, and was chief of all the commanders of the army for the first month.
speaker: Narrator

text: Dodai the Ahohite and his division had charge of the division for the second month, Mikloth being the chief officer; and in his division were 24,000.
speaker: Narrator

text: The third commander of the army for the third month was Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada the priest, as chief; and in his division were 24,000.
speaker: Narrator

text: This Benaiah was the mighty man of the thirty, and had charge of thirty; and over his division was Ammizabad his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fourth for the fourth month was Asahel the brother of Joab, and Zebadiah his son after him; and in his division were 24,000.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fifth for the fifth month was the commander Shamhuth the Izrahite; and in his division were 24,000.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sixth for the sixth month was Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite; and in his division were 24,000.
speaker: Narrator

text: The seventh for the seventh month was Helez the Pelonite of the sons of Ephraim; and in his division were 24,000.
speaker: Narrator

text: The eighth for the eighth month was Sibbecai the Hushathite of the Zerahites; and in his division were 24,000.
speaker: Narrator

text: The ninth for the ninth month was Abiezer the Anathothite of the Benjamites; and in his division were 24,000.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tenth for the tenth month was Maharai the Netophathite of the Zerahites; and in his division were 24,000.
speaker: Narrator

text: The eleventh for the eleventh month was Benaiah the Pirathonite of the sons of Ephraim; and in his division were 24,000.
speaker: Narrator

text: The twelfth for the twelfth month was Heldai the Netophathite of Othniel; and in his division were 24,000.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now in charge of the tribes of Israel: chief officer for the Reubenites was Eliezer the son of Zichri; for the Simeonites, Shephatiah the son of Maacah;
speaker: Narrator

text: for Levi, Hashabiah the son of Kemuel; for Aaron, Zadok;
speaker: Narrator

text: for Judah, Elihu, one of David’s brothers; for Issachar, Omri the son of Michael;
speaker: Narrator

text: for Zebulun, Ishmaiah the son of Obadiah; for Naphtali, Jeremoth the son of Azriel;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the sons of Ephraim, Hoshea the son of Azaziah; for the half-tribe of Manasseh, Joel the son of Pedaiah;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the half-tribe of Manasseh in Gilead, Iddo the son of Zechariah; for Benjamin, Jaasiel the son of Abner;
speaker: Narrator

text: for Dan, Azarel the son of Jeroham. These were the princes of the tribes of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: But David did not count those twenty years of age and under, because the Lord had said He would multiply Israel as the stars of heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joab the son of Zeruiah had begun to count them, but did not finish; and because of this, wrath came upon Israel, and the number was not included in the account of the chronicles of King David.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Azmaveth the son of Adiel had charge of the king’s storehouses. And Jonathan the son of Uzziah had charge of the storehouses in the country, in the cities, in the villages and in the towers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ezri the son of Chelub had charge of the agricultural workers who tilled the soil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shimei the Ramathite had charge of the vineyards; and Zabdi the Shiphmite had charge of the produce of the vineyards stored in the wine cellars.
speaker: Narrator

text: Baal-hanan the Gederite had charge of the olive and sycamore trees in the Shephelah; and Joash had charge of the stores of oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shitrai the Sharonite had charge of the cattle which were grazing in Sharon; and Shaphat the son of Adlai had charge of the cattle in the valleys.
speaker: Narrator

text: Obil the Ishmaelite had charge of the camels; and Jehdeiah the Meronothite had charge of the donkeys.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jaziz the Hagrite had charge of the flocks. All these were overseers of the property which belonged to King David.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also Jonathan, David’s uncle, was a counselor, a man of understanding, and a scribe; and Jehiel the son of Hachmoni tutored the king’s sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahithophel was counselor to the king; and Hushai the Archite was the king’s friend.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehoiada the son of Benaiah, and Abiathar succeeded Ahithophel; and Joab was the commander of the king’s army.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now David assembled at Jerusalem all the officials of Israel, the princes of the tribes, and the commanders of the divisions that served the king, and the commanders of thousands, and the commanders of hundreds, and the overseers of all the property and livestock belonging to the king and his sons, with the officials and the mighty men, even all the valiant men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then King David rose to his feet and said, “Listen to me, my brethren and my people; I had intended to build a permanent home for the ark of the covenant of the Lord and for the footstool of our God. So I had made preparations to build it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God said to me, ‘You shall not build a house for My name because you are a man of war and have shed blood.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet, the Lord, the God of Israel, chose me from all the house of my father to be king over Israel forever. For He has chosen Judah to be a leader; and in the house of Judah, my father’s house, and among the sons of my father He took pleasure in me to make me king over all Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of all my sons (for the Lord has given me many sons), He has chosen my son Solomon to sit on the throne of the kingdom of the Lord over Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to me, ‘Your son Solomon is the one who shall build My house and My courts; for I have chosen him to be a son to Me, and I will be a father to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will establish his kingdom forever if he resolutely performs My commandments and My ordinances, as is done now.’
speaker: Narrator

text: So now, in the sight of all Israel, the assembly of the Lord, and in the hearing of our God, observe and seek after all the commandments of the Lord your God so that you may possess the good land and bequeath it to your sons after you forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: “As for you, my son Solomon, know the God of your father, and serve Him with a whole heart and a willing mind; for the Lord searches all hearts, and understands every intent of the thoughts. If you seek Him, He will let you find Him; but if you forsake Him, He will reject you forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Consider now, for the Lord has chosen you to build a house for the sanctuary; be courageous and act.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David gave to his son Solomon the plan of the porch of the temple, its buildings, its storehouses, its upper rooms, its inner rooms and the room for the mercy seat;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the plan of all that he had in mind, for the courts of the house of the Lord, and for all the surrounding rooms, for the storehouses of the house of God and for the storehouses of the dedicated things;
speaker: Narrator

text: also for the divisions of the priests and the Levites and for all the work of the service of the house of the Lord and for all the utensils of service in the house of the Lord;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the golden utensils, the weight of gold for all utensils for every kind of service; for the silver utensils, the weight of silver for all utensils for every kind of service;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the weight of gold for the golden lampstands and their golden lamps, with the weight of each lampstand and its lamps; and the weight of silver for the silver lampstands, with the weight of each lampstand and its lamps according to the use of each lampstand;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the gold by weight for the tables of showbread, for each table; and silver for the silver tables;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the forks, the basins, and the pitchers of pure gold; and for the golden bowls with the weight for each bowl; and for the silver bowls with the weight for each bowl;
speaker: Narrator

text: and for the altar of incense refined gold by weight; and gold for the model of the chariot, even the cherubim that spread out their wings and covered the ark of the covenant of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: “All this,” said David, “the Lord made me understand in writing by His hand upon me, all the details of this pattern.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David said to his son Solomon, “Be strong and courageous, and act; do not fear nor be dismayed, for the Lord God, my God, is with you. He will not fail you nor forsake you until all the work for the service of the house of the Lord is finished.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now behold, there are the divisions of the priests and the Levites for all the service of the house of God, and every willing man of any skill will be with you in all the work for all kinds of service. The officials also and all the people will be entirely at your command.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then King David said to the entire assembly, “My son Solomon, whom alone God has chosen, is still young and inexperienced and the work is great; for the temple is not for man, but for the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now with all my ability I have provided for the house of my God the gold for the things of gold, and the silver for the things of silver, and the bronze for the things of bronze, the iron for the things of iron, and wood for the things of wood, onyx stones and inlaid stones, stones of antimony and stones of various colors, and all kinds of precious stones and alabaster in abundance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, in my delight in the house of my God, the treasure I have of gold and silver, I give to the house of my God, over and above all that I have already provided for the holy temple,
speaker: Narrator

text: namely, 3,000 talents of gold, of the gold of Ophir, and 7,000 talents of refined silver, to overlay the walls of the buildings;
speaker: Narrator

text: of gold for the things of gold and of silver for the things of silver, that is, for all the work done by the craftsmen. Who then is willing to consecrate himself this day to the Lord?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the rulers of the fathers’ households, and the princes of the tribes of Israel, and the commanders of thousands and of hundreds, with the overseers over the king’s work, offered willingly;
speaker: Narrator

text: and for the service for the house of God they gave 5,000 talents and 10,000 darics of gold, and 10,000 talents of silver, and 18,000 talents of brass, and 100,000 talents of iron.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever possessed precious stones gave them to the treasury of the house of the Lord, in care of Jehiel the Gershonite.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the people rejoiced because they had offered so willingly, for they made their offering to the Lord with a whole heart, and King David also rejoiced greatly.
speaker: Narrator

text: So David blessed the Lord in the sight of all the assembly; and David said, “Blessed are You, O Lord God of Israel our father, forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yours, O Lord, is the greatness and the power and the glory and the victory and the majesty, indeed everything that is in the heavens and the earth; Yours is the dominion, O Lord, and You exalt Yourself as head over all.
speaker: Narrator

text: Both riches and honor come from You, and You rule over all, and in Your hand is power and might; and it lies in Your hand to make great and to strengthen everyone.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore, our God, we thank You, and praise Your glorious name.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But who am I and who are my people that we should be able to offer as generously as this? For all things come from You, and from Your hand we have given You.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we are sojourners before You, and tenants, as all our fathers were; our days on the earth are like a shadow, and there is no hope.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord our God, all this abundance that we have provided to build You a house for Your holy name, it is from Your hand, and all is Yours.
speaker: Narrator

text: Since I know, O my God, that You try the heart and delight in uprightness, I, in the integrity of my heart, have willingly offered all these things; so now with joy I have seen Your people, who are present here, make their offerings willingly to You.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, the God of Abraham, Isaac and Israel, our fathers, preserve this forever in the intentions of the heart of Your people, and direct their heart to You;
speaker: Narrator

text: and give to my son Solomon a perfect heart to keep Your commandments, Your testimonies and Your statutes, and to do them all, and to build the temple, for which I have made provision.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David said to all the assembly, “Now bless the Lord your God.” And all the assembly blessed the Lord, the God of their fathers, and bowed low and did homage to the Lord and to the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the next day they made sacrifices to the Lord and offered burnt offerings to the Lord, 1,000 bulls, 1,000 rams and 1,000 lambs, with their drink offerings and sacrifices in abundance for all Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So they ate and drank that day before the Lord with great gladness.
And they made Solomon the son of David king a second time, and they anointed him as ruler for the Lord and Zadok as priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Solomon sat on the throne of the Lord as king instead of David his father; and he prospered, and all Israel obeyed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the officials, the mighty men, and also all the sons of King David pledged allegiance to King Solomon.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord highly exalted Solomon in the sight of all Israel, and bestowed on him royal majesty which had not been on any king before him in Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now David the son of Jesse reigned over all Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The period which he reigned over Israel was forty years; he reigned in Hebron seven years and in Jerusalem thirty-three years.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he died in a ripe old age, full of days, riches and honor; and his son Solomon reigned in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the acts of King David, from first to last, are written in the chronicles of Samuel the seer, in the chronicles of Nathan the prophet and in the chronicles of Gad the seer,
speaker: Narrator

text: with all his reign, his power, and the circumstances which came on him, on Israel, and on all the kingdoms of the lands.
speaker: Narrator
